hints.label: thm-lsi-qsd
hints.title: Log-Sobolev Inequality (LSI) for QSD
hints.content:
3386: :label: thm-lsi-qsd
3387: 
3388: There exists a constant $\lambda_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ such that for all probability densities $\rho$ on $\Omega$:
3389: 
3390: $$
3391: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) \le \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty)
3392: $$
hints.raw_directive:

hints.raw_directive:
3443: The true QSD $\rho_\infty^x(v)$ is not exactly Gaussian, but it's close (bounded perturbation). Using perturbative LSI theory (Holley-Stroock):
3444: 
3445: :::{prf:theorem} Explicit LSI Constant
3446: :label: thm-lsi-constant-explicit
3447: 
3448: The LSI constant for the QSD satisfies:
3449: 
3450: $$
3451: \boxed{\lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\alpha_{\exp}}{1 + C_{\Delta v}/\alpha_{\exp}}}
3452: $$
3453: 
3454: where:
3455: - $\alpha_{\exp}$ is the exponential concentration rate from (R6)

hints.content:
3458: 
3459: :::{prf:proof}
3460: The proof follows from the Holley-Stroock perturbation theorem. The reference Gaussian measure $\mu(v) = (2\pi/\alpha_{\exp})^{-d/2} e^{-\alpha_{\exp}|v|^2/2}$ has LSI constant $\lambda_0 = \alpha_{\exp}$.
3461: 
3462: The log-ratio $\log(\rho_\infty^x / \mu)$ satisfies:
3463: 
3464: $$
3465: \left|\Delta_v \log \frac{\rho_\infty^x}{\mu}\right| = |\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty^x - \Delta_v \log \mu| = |\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty^x + \alpha_{\exp} d|
3466: $$
3467: 
3468: Using $\|\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty\|_{L^\infty} \le C_{\Delta v}$:
3469: 
3470: $$
3471: \left|\Delta_v \log \frac{\rho_\infty^x}{\mu}\right| \le C_{\Delta v} + \alpha_{\exp} d
3472: $$
3473: 
3474: The Holley-Stroock theorem gives:
3475: 
3476: $$
3477: \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\lambda_0}{1 + C_{\text{perturb}}/\lambda_0}
3478: $$
3479: 
3480: where $C_{\text{perturb}} = C_{\Delta v}$. Substituting $\lambda_0 = \alpha_{\exp}$:
3481: 
3482: $$
3483: \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\alpha_{\exp}}{1 + C_{\Delta v}/\alpha_{\exp}}

hints.label: lem-fisher-bound
hints.title: Fisher Information Bound
hints.content:
3530: :label: lem-fisher-bound
3531: 
3532: There exists a constant $c_F > 0$ such that:
3533: 
3534: $$
3535: I_v(\rho) \ge c_F I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{rem}}
3536: $$
3537: 
3538: where $c_F = 1/2$ and $C_{\text{rem}} = 4C_{\nabla v}^2$.
3539: 
3540: Consequently:
3541: 
3542: $$
3543: \boxed{I_v(\rho) \ge 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{LSI}}}
3544: $$
hints.raw_directive:
